title: Reconstitution of Parkin ubiquitin ligase activity using mouse and human mitochondria
title_html: Reconstitution of Parkin ubiquitin ligase activity using mouse and human mitochondria

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Use sterilized instruments by autoclave or washing them with 70% (vol/vol) ethanol. Dry thoroughly if ethanol is used.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Soak dissection tools in 70% ethanol between embryos to prevent contamination.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description:
In the hood. Prepare
dishes with cold PBS. Separate embryos from uterus and placenta. Place each embryo into a single dish with cold PBS.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Number dishes and Eppendorf tubes for tissue collection for genotyping.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Euthanize the embryos by decapitation and separate the head from the body.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Wash the bodies twice with PBS to minimise contamination and collect a small piece of tail for genotyping.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Place the body on a dish with PBS and remove the red spot (bowel) with forceps.

source.title: PROCEDURE TO ISOLATE AND CULTURE MOUSE EMBRYONIC FIBROBLASTS-Dissection of E13.5 mouse embryos ◊TIMING 20 min

source.description: Place the body on a clean dish and mince the tissue with a spring scissors (or with a sterile scalpel blades).

Prepare digestion medium by adding
of DNase I (stock solution 10 mg/mL) to
of Trypsin 0.025% (1:1 Trypsin 0.05%-HBSS).

Add
of digestion medium to the tissue and transfer in a
falcon tube.

Incubate at
in a water bath for
.

Pipette to mechanically dissociate the tissue, gentle and sequential pipetting (using
,
and
pipettes) until cells are completely suspended.

source.body: Note: The number of trituration is approximative, it may vary depending on the size of the unbroken tissues.

source.description:

of culturing medium.

Centrifuge at
for
.

Remove media and resuspend in
culturing media.

Filter the cells through a
filter.

source.body: Note: The cell suspension should be filtered in order to exclude any undigested tissue pieces or aggregates from the newly prepared cell suspension.

source.description:
Take a
aliquot, add 1:1 ratio Trypan Blu and determine the density of cells and cell viability to the cell counter.

Plate the 3.0 × 106 cells/well plates out on
dishes, containing
of pre-warmed culturing media.

Change media every 5 days, grow to 90% confluence and split (minimum 25% confluence to keep cells within the range to promote growth). The growth rate progressively declines when transformation occurs and the cells become immortal, at approximately after 18 passages (it can be variable).

source.body: Note: In this assay we use primary MEFs between 8-10 passages.

source.title: MITOCHONDRIAL ISOLATION FOR MEFs-Mitochondrial depolarisation ◊TIMING 4h, day of experiment

source.description:
To depolarize or uncouple mitochondrial membrane potential in MEFs, treat the cultures for
with a combination of
Antimycin A and
Oligomycin dissolved in DMSO at
.

source.body: Note: Before the experiment, MEFs were plated in 15 cm dishes and stimulated at 80-90% confluence.

source.description: Gently aspirate the medium from wells.

of warmed DPBS (room temperature) containing protease inhibitors and phosphatase inhibitors.

and add

of Hypotonic Buffer in each tube (for a total of

in the cold room.
Homogenise cells using a stainless steel Dounce homogeniser with 45 strokes.

source.body: Note: Check cell disruption with light microscope, 80-90 % cells should be disrupted.

source.description: Add to the disrupted cells 2.5X MSH buffer and mix.

source.body: Note: Mixing 2.5X MSH volume to the initial volume of hypotonic buffer will give 1X MSH.

Protein quantification: take a small aliquot of mitochondria (10 µL), add 1% Triton, vortex and estimate protein concentration by using the Coomassie Protein Assay.

source.body: Usually from a 15 cm dish of MEFs at 90% confluence it is possible to isolate 200µg of crude mitochondria.

source.description:
Resuspend isolated mitochondria in MUB buffer at concentration ~

at

Analyse samples by running
of reaction on Nu-page Bis-Tris 4-12% gels for a better resolution of ubiquitin chains, at 120 V for ~2h. Use MES SDS Running Buffer or MOPS SDS Running Buffer according to the size of protein to be analysed.

source.body: For phospho-parkin and Parkin blots, it is recommended to dilute the final reaction 1 in 25 with 1X LDS containing 2.5 % 2- mercaptoethanol.

source.description:
Transfer gel on PVDF membrane for phospho-ubiquitin and ubiquitin signal and nitrocellulose membrane for phospho-Parkin and Parkin signal. Transfer in Towbin buffer at 80 V for

or in cold room (for HK1 it is recommended to transfer at 90 V for 1.5h).

source.body: Note: Prepare only 1 membrane per transfer tank –avoid multiple membranes for transfer in same tank as this reduces ubiquitin transfer.

source.description:
Incubate membrane with blocking buffer 5% milk in 0.1% TBS-Tween for
at

Remove blocking buffer, if primary antibodies are in 5% BSA, rinse twice with 0.1% TBS-Tween to remove any traces of milk, add primary antibodies and incubate
at
.

source.body: Note: Prepare phospho-Ubiquitin Antibody (1:2000), Ubiquitin Antibody (1:1000), CISD1 Antibody (1:1000), CPT1α Antibody (1:1000), CYB5B Antibody (1:1000), HK1 Antibody (1:1000), MFN2 Antibody (1:1000), VDAC Antibody (1:1000) and Parkin Antibody (1:1000) in 5% BSA (TBS-Tween). Prepare phospho-Parkin Antibody (1:2000) in 5% milk (TBS-Tween). To avoid non-specific signal, it is recommended to preincubate phospho-Parkin antibody with a membrane for 2 days before using it.

Remove secondary antibody and wash 3 times with 0.1%TBS-Tween for
.
Develop signal using ECL western Blotting reagents and analysing with Chemidoc.

source.body: Note: Depending on signal, film can be best for sensitivity. To improve detection of HK1 and VDAC ubiquitylation, it is recommended to develop signal using Super signal West Dura reagents.

description: Analysis of Parkinson’s linked genes PINK1 and Parkin has uncovered a mechanism by which upon loss of mitochondrial membrane potential, Parkin E3 ubiquitin ligase activity is activated by PINK1 kinase activity, to trigger mitochondrial membrane protein ubiquitylation, leading to removal of damaged mitochondria (mitophagy). We and other groups have previously reported in vitro assays of Parkin E3 ligase activity using recombinant Parkin and PINK1 expressed in E. coli. This provided evidence of Parkin activation by PINK1 phosphorylation of Ser65 in both ubiquitin and UBL domain of Parkin. Herein, we report a reconstitution assay in which addition of recombinant Parkin to mitochondria isolated from cells after treatment by combination of Antimycin A and Oligomycin (to induce PINK1 activation on the outer mitochondrial membrane), enables robust ubiquitylation of multiple substrates at the mitochondria. This assay represents a powerful tool to study Parkin E3 ligase activity and the functional interplay between ubiquitylation and phosphorylation mediated by PINK1 and Parkin and their role in reshaping the endogenous mitochondrial proteome.
